item.description:
Hi Everyone,

Yes some of us will show up on Thursday but i guess most will be showing up Friday sometime, Saturday or whenever.

I will bring my Pop Up Can - o- Pee with screen sides and an extra large tarp just incase.

The grill and extra fake fire logs also if it is rainy.

I agree  with Barbara, instead of the ninnygret fish fry, Lets plan out a simple trip to the local market and each get one of the following maybe 5 or 6 bucks ???? worth of  shrimps, scallops, clams, some fish, or whatever and have a pot luck style buff -a at the camp site.

If you like "SLURPERS" YOU can have them too..

We can do all of our meals this way, Eggs, pan cakes..etc whatever..

So join us for any part of the weekend, the kayaking, the whatever the desire is based on the weather. A trip to Block Head Island is an option too.

Lenore knows the Block Island routine well and can suggest spots there and the ways with the parking, ferry and costs..etc... As best i know of that is one of a very few option(s) for friday provided we have good weather..etc..and who shows up Thursday or when ? on Friday.

I never took the ferry or have no idea about this method, many years ago i just used to fly there, tie down,  and have the taxie take us to spots.

Beaches ?? i dont know any of them so its nice to have someone lead them also.

So it feels good not having to lead this or any trip this time.. its vacation weekend for me...

all i want to plan is what goes on my food plate...and even then its what ever we add to a pot luck buff - A theme that is good to do. for the meal..

See some of you there..

al-r

 

 

To Those who want to attend but our reserved sites are filled.  Contact ReserveAmerica.com and book a site.  Then post a comment to ask if anyone wants to share with you.   You will most probably get one or two tenters to share.  Remember that we do not have children or pets on these campouts.  Thanks. 

Sites are now filled; each site has 3 tents (paid); If you would like to join the group for camping and have not paid your fee; then contact Reserveamerica.com so that you can camp (we are camping in the fisherman's area).  Others who want to come for kayaking; then you can meet us at the site;  there is a day fee for you to enter the park and we can then caravan together.  Or you can phone me or another member that morning to "meetup" with us and let us know that you will be kayaking.

Hi Everyone,

THE EVENT DATES are:  August 5 to 8;

You can also opt to attend just the kayak day trips.  

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Night time ac tivity may include a NEARBY (Ninneygret Park) trip to THE CHARLSTOWN  SEAFOOD FESTIVAL with FIREWORKS :

http://www.charlestownrichamber.com/seafoodfestival.html

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

BARBARA is organizing the camping.  304, 306, 309 have been reserved.  Please contact bg3step@comcast.net to be included;  A deposit of $30pp (=total cost) is requested  to secure your space.  3 tents per site / or/ up to 6 people per site. 

Steve is organizing the kayaking day trip(s).

Al is the leader of the meetup group and wants to take a break this one time to enjoy the life of a homeless person.

Kayak renting:  Al, Barbara and Steve will bring a couple of yaks for those interested @ a nominal price per kayak for the day.

Please ask us which yaks and equipment are more appropriate for you prior to us leaving for the trip.

 

Camping:  Join us for a fun camping experience at a Premier camp facility close to ocean, rivers and lakes.  Lots of things to do in the area, that are reasonably priced, ex., Free movies in the evening on the beach; Live music on the beach; restaurants. 

 

Potluck meals: We will have our traditional potluck dinners and probably breakfast too. 

Please COORDINATE WITH US TO FILL THE SITES ALREADY RESERVED OR book yourself a reservation through RESERVE AMERICA and look for the 300 area .  It is the Fisherman's area.   We will be right on a large lake where we can sunset kayak too!  Please book right away because these sites tend to book up prior to the dates.  We have two campsites booked.  Barbara, Al and Steve have lots of camping equipment to make our dining and campfire gatherings comfortable.  But, if you have your own, then please bring with you.

Kayaking:  We will kayak as a group, led by Steve, down the Narrow river .  The Narrow river is awesome, highlighting beautiful wildlife and is a fairly easy paddle.  It will take practically all day because we will then stop on a beautiful peninsula beach, have refreshments and enjoy the ocean where the ocean meets the river. 

We "MAY" do another kayak trip on an alternate day at some other close location.

I and Strawberry just did the Barn Island to Napatree on July 22, we will return as a group someday-- but not on this camping trip, there are really 4 foot waves out there in certain places..

---------------------------------------------------

On your own:  You are not obligated to kayak, if you'd prefer to enjoy the area beaches, or what ever, then please feel free.  You can join us in the evening for potluck dinners and laughs around the campfire.

If anyone wants to, they can do a trip to Block Island for apx $20 round trip boat fare  Lenore has a lot of Block Island info..(bikes $ ?)

To Book your own site go to:  ReserveAmerica.com  To be included in one of the three sites, please indicate on your RSVP and send money to Barbara.  There is a 4 day minimum to reserve these spots on the website.  We will be in the Fisherman's Camp area #304, 306, and 309

Map of the sites:

http://www.riparks.com/pdfs/Burlmap.pdf


Up to 3 tents on each site is allowable

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

USE THE BURLINGAME WEBSITE FOR FURTHER INFO AND DIRECTIONS IF YOU NEED THEM.
http://www.riparks.com/burlgmcamp.htm

 

al-r - Barbara - Steve

304 & 306 & 309 have been reserved.  "Fishermans 300's Area" This is also adjacent to Natchog Pond for a evening or  Daytime paddle.
item.how_to_find_us: Campers: 300's* Fishermans Camp Area: --------> Kayaking: The Narrow River Exploration---- Other Options too: Block Island & Beaches + ?
item.why: Join us! Its a simple get away and paddle in a place we rarely get to go to.

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: RI BURLINGAME Campout / Kayak Day Trips & SeaFood Fest- AUGUST 4-8 (or any part)
